radiographic_examinations.findings: Clear lungs, borderline enlargement of the cardiomediastinal silhouette, and atherosclerotic calcification of the aortic arch.
Mild, diffuse cerebral parenchymal volume loss; prominence of the cerebrospinal fluid spaces; no evidence of acute intracranial hemorrhage, territorial infarction, or intracranial mass lesion.
Normal left ventricular ejection fraction and cavity size; subtle hypokinesis of the inferior wall; two masses with heterogeneous echotexture compressing the tricuspid annulus.
Two aneurysmal segments of the saphenous-vein graft measuring 4.4 cm and 4.0 cm in greatest dimension, causing mass effect and compression of the right atrioventricular groove and right ventricle.
Two masses with heterogeneous echotexture compressing the tricuspid annulus and right atrium.
Large proximal aneurysmal segment with poor but intact distal flow.
